Description.1: Group Project: Group Project (Brightspace discussions) with Online Poster Presentation
Description.3: Lab Report: Based on two laboratory experiments that all students are expected to complete, while working in pairs, and collaborating with other pairs. Each lab is weighted equally.
Description.4: Examination: An end of trimester online MCQ examination will assess each student's overall understanding of the module. Resit students will be assessed wholly on the basis of this written examination.
Description.5: Group Project: Groups of students (approximately 5 per group) will be required to collaborate on an assignment that is intended to allow students to demonstrate their understanding of key concepts of this module.
Description.6: Class Test: In-class MCQ tests will be set randomly throughout the trimester, without announcement, to provide students with formative feedback on their understanding of course material.
Description.7: Examination: In-person, 2-hour, end of trimester exam
Description.8: Class Test: Online BrightSpace Quiz (50 minutes)
Description.10: Lab Report: Two Reports to be submitted by each student, following participation in a scheduled laboratory practical session.
Description.14: Continuous Assessment: Laboratory sessions and online quizzes
Description.35: Portfolio: Set of Engineering Sketches, Drawings and Designs. Also in-class tests.
Description.36: Examination: MCQ and short answer questions
Description.37: Lab Report: Metallography of steels and brasses
Description.39: Lab Report: Heat treatment and impact testing
Description.47: Lab Report: Lab Report 2 - Laboratory experiment
Description.48: Lab Report: Lab Report 1 - Finite Element Analysis
Description.59: Assignment: One essay type assignment per student
Description.60: Group Project: One design, build and test project with individual and group assessment
Description.70: Lab Report: Marks based on 2 laboratory assignments
Description.78: Class Test: In-semester class test #2 (online quiz)
Description.79: Group Project: A group project assignment which will commence from week 7.
Description.80: Class Test: In-semester class test #1 (online quiz)
Description.81: Examination: End of semester Brightspace examination
Description.82: Lab Report: A computational experiment will be undertaken wherein each student will simulate using computational fluid dynamics the blood flow in an abdominal aortic aneurysm under steady and periodic flow.
Description.83: Assignment: Write an essay on the application of the engineering methodology
Description.84: Assignment: Written and oral presentation of a scientific report in form of an Abstract and Poster Presentation
Description.85: Attendance: Students are required to spend six hours per week in the laboratory of their research group.
Description.86: Journal: Students will be required to keep a lab notebook detailing their laboratory based activities throughout the duration of the placement.
Description.87: Continuous Assessment: Student performance: acquisition of skills, good engineering practice, data management and analysis
Description.88: Journal: In addition to the Laboratory Journal, students will be required to keep a short Learning Journal detailing and reflecting upon their experiences, views and suggestions regarding working within a lab.
Description.91: Project: Final Project Report and Interview (End of Trimester 2).
Description.92: Project: Interim Project Report (Beginning of Trimester 2).
Description.93: Essay: Essay on topic selected by student from a list of topics (approx 2000 words).
Description.94: Examination: Assessment of material presented by Lecturer #21-hour Invigilated Closed-book Assessment. Monday 14th, November 2022.
Description.95: Examination: Assessment of material presented by Lecturer #11-hour Invigilated Closed-book Assessment. Monday 10th, October 2022.
Description.96: Examination: Assessment of material presented by Lecturer #31-hour invigilated Closed-book End of Trimester Examination
Description.100: Group Project: Group Technical Report and Presentation
Description.102: Examination: Written exam. The default scale (Default 40%) is used.
Description.103: Continuous Assessment: Online Tutorial 1 [5%]Online Tutorial 2 [5%]In-class test 1 [2.5%]Online Tutorial 3 [5%]In-class test 2 [2.5%]Online Tutorial 4 [5%]Online Tutorial 5 [5%]
Description.104: Lab Report: Lab report to be submitted via Brightspace.
Description.107: Lab Report: Lab report to be submitted via Brightspace: Failure Analysis Laboratory.
Description.108: Assignment: Essay type research assignment. Students will have approximately 4 weeks to complete the assignment, beginning around mid-trimester.
Description.119: Continuous Assessment: An individual project including a report and/or presentation
Description.120: Continuous Assessment: Continuous assessment lab assignments
Description.121: Continuous Assessment: Continuous assessment online quizzes
Description.123: Assignment: Assignments will be based on use of computer programs to devise phase diagrams from thermodynamic data, and to develop insight into important parameters and how they vary with lab conditions.
Description.127: Lab Report: One lab report to be submitted via Brightspace - Laboratory Experiment to demonstrate a concept discussed in lectures.
Description.129: Assignment: Studies using computational fluid dynamics
Description.133: Continuous Assessment: Group and individual assignments related to the semester-long project.
Description.134: Group Project: Various Assignments and Case Studies
Description.138: Attendance: Participation during case study discussion sessions
Description.139: Continuous Assessment: Industry based teaching case study development
Description.146: Project: Industry Based Decision Analysis Application
Description.149: Assignment: Individual essay assignment on an Economics topic
Description.150: Examination: Final examination focused on Management and Law course content
Description.151: Group Project: Group assignment - prerecorded Ethics presentation and written script
Description.152: Journal: Diary of experiences. Final Report summarising experiences under "General Learning", "Technical Learning" and Personal Learning" headings. Appraisal forms from Employer and UCD Academic Staff.
Description.153: Journal: Diary of experiences. Final Report summarising experiences under "General Learning", "Technical Learning" and Personal Learning" headings. Appraisal forms from Employer and UCD Academic Staff.
Description.156: Assignment: Assignment 4: IP/Patents and Horizon Scan - based on points from Hugh Hayden’s lecture as applied to your project: (10%)
Description.157: Assignment: Assignment 1: 1.	Assignment 1: Critical Review of Journal Paper (reviewed by subject specialists & second marked) (20% of overall grade)
Description.158: Assignment: Assignment 3: Experimental Design and Analysis - (20%)
Description.160: Assignment: Assignment 5: State of the Art Review (to be marked by supervisors & subject specialist markers (30%)
Description.165: Group Project: Group Project Report in the form of an Enterprise Ireland Grant Application to develop your technology
Description.166: Presentation: Project Update Presentations & Final Presentation Grade
Description.167: Attendance: Grade based on Attendance, Interaction with the Module, Individual, Mentor and Peer-Assessment Reports

Description.170: Assignment: A medical device related assignment

Description.174: Multiple Choice Questionnaire: x1 multiple choice in class examination associated with the lectures delivered by Prof Kenneth Stanton
Description.175: Continuous Assessment: In-class engagement exercises x10.
Description.176: Group Project: Communication Exercise 3: Give short presentation on a technical topic of their choice using tools: analogies, examples, demo’s, stories, graphs, videos, visuals, interaction. Also 1500-word report.
Description.177: Group Project: Communication Exercise 1: This will involve groups choosing a topic, and then delivering a 5-minute presentation and a 1000-word report on this topic.
Description.179: Group Project: Communication Exercise 2: Each group slects both static (newspaper, magazine, book) and dynamic (video, presentation) communication and appraises each via short presentation & a 1500-word report.
Description.184: Continuous Assessment: •	A brief letter will be sought from an employer or Academic Supervisor commenting on the engagement of the student with the process and highlighting any particular achievements.
Description.185: Fieldwork: •	Students must complete a Final report, summarising their experiences, with specific reference to the “General Learning”, “Technical Learning” and “Personal Learning” headings.
Description.186: Journal: •	Students are required to keep a Diary of their experience, to be shown to the module coordinator or academic supervisor, on request.
Description.187: Presentation: •	Students may be required to present for Oral Examination on completion of the placement.
Description.188: Fieldwork: •	Diary, •	Final Report, •	10-minute presentation,•	An assessment from an employer,•	Oral Examination may be required .This module is on a 'Pass/Fail' basis and is “grade neutral”.
Description.189: Assignment: Industry Analysis using Financial Accounting principles
Description.191: Assignment: Interim Report with Research Plan
Description.193: Essay: Final Thesis Submission and viva voce

Description.209: Group Project: Report which provides analysis of major project.
Description.211: Presentation: Presentation based on group project
Description.213: Group Project: Group presentation and report critiquing two communication samples.
Description.214: Project: Presentation outline plan, audience analysis and visual samples. Done individually.
Description.215: Group Project: Presentation and report (on presentation plan) on a technical topic.
Description.216: Class Test: In-semester exam on course theory.
Description.225: Assignment: Group report and presentation, to be submitted no later than the end of week 6
Description.226: Assignment: Individual Report, to be submitted no later than December 18th.
Description.228: Assignment: Performing as a competent demonstrator.Students will submit written and video materials to evidence their capabilities as a teaching assistant
Description.229: Group Project: "Peer discussion on teaching experiences" Students will participate in an ongoing peer discussion through Brightspace
Description.230: Portfolio: Peer observation and feedbackIn pairs, students observe each others work as teaching assistance and provide observations, feedback and reflection
Description.231: Assignment: Understanding research integrityStudents must demonstrate that they have engaged with and passed online research integrity training.
Description.233: Continuous Assessment: Concept generation, development and pitching.
Description.236: Examination: 2 hour end of semester exam.
Description.237: Presentation: Group Presentation: Each group (approx. 3 students) is assigned one theorist/theoretical stance. 15 mins
Description.238: Essay: Critical Review: A critical analysis of a key text assessing it from a theoretical standpoint. 5,000 words
Description.239: Attendance: Active & engaged attendance at all sessions; involvement in discussions and seminar activities.
Description.240: Presentation: Solo Presentation: The subject matter should relate in this module/week to a theoretical or philosophical aspect of their research. 15 mins
Description.243: Project: Final report assessment.Each group will be asked to complete a peer-review form at the end of the project where group members will evaluate their peers' performance with regards to various factors
Description.245: Presentation: A presentation and diary will have to be submitted
Description.247: Project: Final Project Report. 15,000 words. Due week 12 Spring Trimester
Description.248: Assignment: 5,000 word Interim Report. Due week 1 Spring Trimester.
Description.249: Group Project: Group assignment on specific industrial areas and applications
Description.254: Examination: Examination assessment accounts for the final exam.
Description.257: Group Project: Include a presentation and a written report. Students will be graded on their understanding and analysis of the issues and techniques involved, as well as solution proposals where applicable.
Description.259: Class Test: Application of tools and techniques
Description.260: Group Project: This is an assessed group project.
Description.263: Assignment: This is a comprehensive individual assignment based on lab activities.
Description.266: Presentation: A presentation will be delivered at the end of the project.
Description.272: Multiple Choice Questionnaire: Multiple choice questionnaire testing understanding of how mechanical forces influence the formation, physiology, disease and degeneration of the musculoskeletal system
Description.273: Lab Report: Lab reports on a) FE Bio and b) OpenSim (5% each)
Description.274: Presentation: Student topic presentations. 6% for presentation and 4% for peer-assessment of others presentations
Description.275: Continuous Assessment: Online discussion forums of relevant topics. Seven topics will be discussed: 1–3% for each topic (percentage depends on topic and will be communicated)
Description.276: Attendance: Attendance and active participation in at least 60% of the scheduled activities is required in order to pass this module. Activities will be scheduled over a continuous 5-day period.
Description.277: Attendance: Attendance and active participation in at least 60% of the scheduled activities is required in order to pass this module. Activities will be scheduled over a continuous 5-day period.
Description.279: Assignment: This is a comprehensive individual assignment based on lab activities.
Description.281: Group Project: This is an assessed group project.
Description.282: Presentation: Final presentation to be done at UCD by the end of the Spring Trimester. A separate presentation may be required depending on the Entry university requirement.
Description.284: Project: Final report assessment where students will need to submit individual project reports (even if the project is done in a group) to UCD and a separate one to the Entry university if required.
Description.287: Continuous Assessment: The student will be assessed on their progress throughout the module.
Description.288: Presentation: The student will be asked to present the a summary of the work they carry out during the module.
